meanings.definition: A neuromuscular disorder characterized by weakness and fatigue of voluntary muscles.
meanings.sent1: Myasthenia can make it hard to lift heavy objects.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed her with myasthenia after she struggled to climb stairs.
meanings.sent3: Carrying groceries felt like a myasthenia challenge for him.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world on her shoulders felt like myasthenia.
meanings.sent5: His myasthenia made him feel like a deflating balloon.

meanings.definition: A condition in which nerve impulses are not properly transmitted to muscles.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that myasthenia affects the communication between nerves and muscles.
meanings.sent2: Her myasthenia caused her muscles to weaken due to poor nerve signals.
meanings.sent3: The miscommunication between nerves and muscles in myasthenia felt like a game of telephone.
meanings.sent4: His myasthenia turned his body into a disconnected puppet.
meanings.sent5: The faulty nerve signals in myasthenia were like crossed wires in a circuit.

meanings.definition: Weakness and rapid fatigue of muscles.
meanings.sent1: After a short walk, she felt the myasthenia setting in.
meanings.sent2: His myasthenia made it hard for him to keep up with his friends during sports.
meanings.sent3: Trying to run a marathon with myasthenia would be like trying to sprint through quicksand.
meanings.sent4: The myasthenia in her legs made them feel like jelly.
meanings.sent5: The myasthenia in his arms made them as heavy as lead.
